briefTitle: Study Investigating a Standard Regimen in de Novo Kidney Transplant Patients Versus a Calcineurin Inhibitor (CNI)-Free Regimen and a CNI-low Dose Regimen

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion criteria

* Males or females, aged 18 - 70 years
* Recipients of de novo cadaveric, living unrelated or living related kidney transplants
* Females capable of becoming pregnant must have a negative serum pregnancy test within 7 days prior to or at screening, and are required to practice an approved method of birth control for the duration of the study and for a period of 6 weeks following discontinuation of study medication, even where there has been a history of infertility.
* Patients who are willing and able to participate in the study and from whom written informed consent has been obtained.

Exclusion criteria

* More than one previous renal transplantation
* Multi-organ recipients (e.g., kidney and pancreas) or previous transplant with any other organ, different from kidney
* Patients receiving a kidney from a non-heart beating donor
* Donor age: \< 5 years or \> 70 years
* Graft loss due to immunological reasons in the first year after transplantation (in case of secondary transplantation)
* Other protocol-defined inclusion/exclusion criteria may apply

outcomeMeasures.title: GFR Via Nankivell Method at Month 12 - CNI-Free vs Standard Regimen
outcomeMeasures.description: Demonstrate superiority of CNI-Free vs Standard Regimen in GFR using the Nankivell formula (GFR = 6.7 / Scr + BW / 4 - Surea / 2-100 / (height)² + C where where Scr is the serum creatinine concentration expressed in mmol/L, BW the body weight in kilograms, Surea the serum urea in mmol/L, height in m, and the constant C is 35 for male and 25 for female patients. The calculated GFR is expressed in mL/min per 1.73m², last observation carried forward (LOCF) was used for imputation of missing values, ANCOVA model, with treatment, center, donor type (deceased vs. living) as factors and BL2-value at V4/M3/BL2 as covariate. P-values are not adjusted

outcomeMeasures.title: GFR Via Nankivell Formula at Month 12 - All Regimens
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in GFR using the Nankivell formula (GFR = 6.7 / Scr + BW / 4 - Surea / 2-100 / (height)² + C where where Scr is the serum creatinine concentration expressed in mmol/L, BW the body weight in kilograms, Surea the serum urea in mmol/L, height in m, and the constant C is 35 for male and 25 for female patients. The calculated GFR is expressed in mL/min per 1.73m², last observation carried forward (LOCF) was used for imputation of missing values, ANCOVA model, with treatment, center, donor type (deceased vs. living) as factors and BL2-value at V4/M3/BL2 as covariate.

outcomeMeasures.title: GFR at Month 12 Utilizing Modification of Diet in Renal Disease (MDRD) Method
outcomeMeasures.description:
Change in GFR (Modification of Diet in Renal Disease calculated using the -MDRD formulat:

For men: GFR = 170 × (serum creatinine -0,999)×(age-0,176) x (urea nitrogen -0,17) × (albumin0,318) For women: GFR = 170 × (serum creatinine -0,999) × (age-0,176) × (urea nitrogen -0,17) x (albumin0,318) × 0.762 with urea nitrogen = urea / 2.144. ), last observation carried forward (LOCF) was used for imputation of missing values, ANCOVA model, with treatment, center, donor type (deceased vs. living) as factors and BL2-value at V4/M3/BL2 as covariate.

outcomeMeasures.title: GFR at Month 12 Utilizing Cockcroft-Gault Formula
outcomeMeasures.description: Cockcroft-Gault formula: For men: GFR= ((140-age) × body weight in kg)∕(72 x serum creatinine in mg∕dl)For women: GFR= (0.85×(140-age) × body weight in kg)∕(72 x serum creatinine in mg/dl), ), last observation carried forward (LOCF) was used for imputation of missing values, ANCOVA model

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Change in Serum Creatinine From Month 3 to Month 12
outcomeMeasures.description: Change in venous blood serum creatinine. Last observation carried forward (LOCF) was used for imputation of missing values, ANCOVA model

outcomeMeasures.title: Efficacy Event Data From Baseline 2 (Month 3) to Month 6
outcomeMeasures.description: Efficacy events were: Biopsy-proven acute rejection (BPAR), graft loss, death, and treatment failure (defined as composite endpoint of BPAR, graft loss, death, loss to follow-up, discontinuation due to lack of efficacy or due to toxicity).

outcomeMeasures.title: Efficacy Event Data Baseline 2 (Month 3) to Month 12
outcomeMeasures.description: Efficacy events were: Biopsy-proven acute rejection (BPAR), graft loss, death, and treatment failure (defined as composite endpoint of BPAR, graft loss, death, loss to follow-up, discontinuation due to lack of efficacy or due to toxicity).

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From BL2 (Month 3) to Month 12 in Cardiovascular Risk (Framingham Score; 10-year Cardiovascular Risk)
outcomeMeasures.description: The Framingham Score (based on LDL cholesterol level) estimates the coronary heart disease risk (%) of developing one of the following coronary heart diseases: angina pectoris, myocardial infarction, or coronary disease death, over the course of 10 years.

outcomeMeasures.description: Change in GFR using the Nankivell formula (GFR = 6.7 / Scr + BW / 4 - Surea / 2-100 / (height)² + C where where Scr is the serum creatinine concentration expressed in mmol/L, BW the body weight in kilograms, Surea the serum urea in mmol/L, height in m, and the constant C is 35 for male and 25 for female patients. For men: GFR = 170 × (serum creatinine -0,999)×(age-0,176) x (urea nitrogen -0,17) × (albumin0,318) For women: GFR = 170 × (serum creatinine -0,999) × (age-0,176) × (urea nitrogen -0,17) x (albumin0,318) × 0.762 with urea nitrogen = urea / 2.144. ), last observation carried forward (LOCF) was used for imputation of missing values, ANCOVA model, with treatment, center, donor type (deceased vs. living) as factors and BL2-value at V4/M3/BL2 as covariate.
